intro: Restrepiella norae, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its mountainous habitat. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
